name: msemen mahjouba
ingredients: For the dough: 500g of extra fine semolina, 250g of flour, 1 teaspoon of powdered sugar, 1/2 teaspoon of instant yeast, 1 and a half teaspoons of salt, 400ml of warm water

For the filling (Mahjouba or stuffed msemen): 4 large chopped onions, 2 peppers (one red and one yellow), 1 garlic clove, 2 tablespoons of chopped parsley, 4 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 teaspoon of tomato paste, pepper, sweet paprika, cumin, 1 and a half teaspoons of salt, harissa (optional), 2 large peeled and blended tomatoes
steps: Prepare the dough: Mix the dry ingredients, add the warm water, and knead until you get an elastic and smooth dough. Form balls and let rest (msemen dough).
Prepare the filling: Saut√© the onion, garlic, and peppers in olive oil. Add the tomatoes, tomato paste, parsley, spices, salt, and harissa. Let simmer until the filling is cooked and thick.
Shaping: Roll out a ball of dough thinly to get a large thin square. Place a tablespoon of filling in the center.
Fold the dough to form a closed square (like an envelope), enclosing the filling.
Cook the mhajeb/stuffed msemen in a very hot oiled pan until golden and crispy on both sides. Serve hot.
